content.description: After a slightly crumbly start, spectacular climbing leads to the anchors. If you are in the area, do it!
content.location: This is the right route on the east side of Center Stage Tower.

content.description:
Climb up to the roof. After figuring out a sequence that works for you to pull over, make a huge span out left to a crimp rail. Ride crimps to the chains.

Unless some crucial holds broke off at the roof, the guidebook rating of .11c is a sandbag. Also the reach out left will be interesting for anyone with a <6 foot wingspan. That said, it is fun and interesting climbing from the roof to the chains.
content.protection: 6 bolts to an anchor. Using a long sling on the low first bolt might help the belayer.
content.location: This is the left of the two bolted routes on the east side of the "Central Stage" formation which has an obvious 4 foot roof halfway up.
